data.title: Poseidon
data.meta_description: Poseidon meaning: 1. in Greek mythology (= ancient stories), the god of water and the sea:  2. in Greek mythology…. Learn more.
data.text:
noun

us

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/poʊˈsaɪ.dən/ uk

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/pəˈsaɪ.dən/

More examplesFewer examples

Dolphins guided the god of the sea, Poseidon, to his lover Amphitrite.

He erected a bronze statue of a dolphin rider on the clifftops, honoring Poseidon, God of the Sea.

Poseidon and the other gods decided to punish them, and swallowed the island with a great wave.

Athena wears a golden crown and the sea god, Poseidon, has thick, matted hair tinted green.
